issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

fields.summary: Raise Exception upon failure to produce credentials

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h4. Description of the issue
When attempting to get credentials using the admin tools (either euca_conf or euca-get-credentials) they cannot be downloaded.

h4. Expected results
Credentials are downloaded successfully.

h4. Actual results
An error message is returned when trying to negotiate a connection.

{code}
[root@odc-d-06-05 ~]# euca-get-credentials --debug admin.zip
2013-11-15 13:45:30,831 GetCredentials [DEBUG]:request_params: {'account': 'eucalyptus', 'zipfile': 'admin.zip', 'user': 'admin'}
2013-11-15 13:45:30,970 GetCredentials [ERROR]:Caught exception reading instance data
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/boto/utils.py", line 211, in retry_url
    r = opener.open(req)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/urllib2.py", line 391, in open
    response = self._open(req, data)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/urllib2.py", line 409, in _open
    '_open', req)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/urllib2.py", line 369, in _call_chain
    result = func(*args)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/urllib2.py", line 1198, in https_open
    return self.do_open(httplib.HTTPSConnection, req)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/urllib2.py", line 1165, in do_open
    raise URLError(err)
URLError: <urlopen error [Errno 1] _ssl.c:492: error:100AE081:elliptic curve routines:EC_GROUP_new_by_curve_name:unknown group>
2013-11-15 13:45:30,971 GetCredentials [ERROR]:Unable to read instance data, giving up
{code}

h4. More information
Using *openssl s_client* to connect to Eucalyptus on Centos 6.4

{code}
$ openssl -showcerts -connect localhost:8443
{code}

Returns
{code}
<snip>
---
Server certificate
subject=/C=US/O=Cloud/OU=Eucalyptus/CN=db
issuer=/C=US/O=Cloud/OU=Eucalyptus/CN=db
---
No client certificate CA names sent
---
SSL handshake has read 1440 bytes and written 278 bytes
---
New, TLSv1/SSLv3, Cipher is DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA
Server public key is 2048 bit
Secure Renegotiation IS supported
Compression: NONE
Expansion: NONE
SSL-Session:
    Protocol  : TLSv1
    Cipher    : DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA
    Session-ID: 5286973945E72D5B9783C020611FEBF95DA6FBBF01291A49CBDF4730E1AF933F
    Session-ID-ctx: 
    Master-Key: E24B21D932D0A1072CDB2FB19740444EEBC4953BCA06461703CAD2A6C509242F2C77AE0FEB7C910C96308936739D24AB
    Key-Arg   : None
    Krb5 Principal: None
    PSK identity: None
    PSK identity hint: None
    Start Time: 1384552249
    Timeout   : 300 (sec)
    Verify return code: 18 (self signed certificate)
---
{code}

But on RHEL 6.5 beta the same command returns
{code}
depth=0 C = US, O = Cloud, OU = Eucalyptus, CN = db
verify error:num=18:self signed certificate
verify return:1
depth=0 C = US, O = Cloud, OU = Eucalyptus, CN = db
verify return:1
140455033534280:error:100AE081:elliptic curve routines:EC_GROUP_new_by_curve_name:unknown group:ec_curve.c:316:
140455033534280:error:1408D010:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_KEY_EXCHANGE:EC lib:s3_clnt.c:1641:
<snip>
---
Server certificate
subject=/C=US/O=Cloud/OU=Eucalyptus/CN=db
issuer=/C=US/O=Cloud/OU=Eucalyptus/CN=db
---
No client certificate CA names sent
---
SSL handshake has read 1334 bytes and written 0 bytes
---
New, (NONE), Cipher is (NONE)
Server public key is 2048 bit
Secure Renegotiation IS supported
Compression: NONE
Expansion: NONE
SSL-Session:
    Protocol  : TLSv1.2
    Cipher    : 0000
    Session-ID: 528697A8851872C42C92381938C549CBE4E1212998CEE066AEE8E1A3E9D2B352
    Session-ID-ctx: 
    Master-Key: 
    Key-Arg   : None
    Krb5 Principal: None
    PSK identity: None
    PSK identity hint: None
    Start Time: 1384552360
    Timeout   : 300 (sec)
    Verify return code: 18 (self signed certificate)
---
{code}

But if the protocol is chosen to be SSLv3, then the connection is successful on RHEL 6.5 beta

{code}
<snip>
---
Server certificate
subject=/C=US/O=Cloud/OU=Eucalyptus/CN=db
issuer=/C=US/O=Cloud/OU=Eucalyptus/CN=db
---
No client certificate CA names sent
---
SSL handshake has read 1327 bytes and written 290 bytes
---
New, TLSv1/SSLv3, Cipher is ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA
Server public key is 2048 bit
Secure Renegotiation IS supported
Compression: NONE
Expansion: NONE
SSL-Session:
    Protocol  : SSLv3
    Cipher    : ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA
    Session-ID: 528698B0708BCAA2CECE925F2C5C96477C78250564D441A6F8419F9EB17CB60D
    Session-ID-ctx: 
    Master-Key: F547F55D8E19E2435EA1A73FB1F781B59D74C333D934C2F54B96A1856DF30EE9A235B7947BF986D50CC300BB5F02527E
    Key-Arg   : None
    Krb5 Principal: None
    PSK identity: None
    PSK identity hint: None
    Start Time: 1384552624
    Timeout   : 7200 (sec)
    Verify return code: 18 (self signed certificate)
---
{code}

A patch that fixes getcredentials is attached, but it's not clear if that is the best solution.
fields.summary: Unable to get credentials when running on RHEL 6.5 beta

comments.body:
This appears to be due to the following issue:

  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1025598

this is fixed in the package:

  openssl.x86_64 0:1.0.1e-16.el6_5

I recommend closing this issue as won't fix.

{code}
[centoslive@livecd ~]$ rpm -qi openssl.x86_64
Name        : openssl                      Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 1.0.1e                            Vendor: CentOS
Release     : 16.el6_5                      Build Date: Tue 03 Dec 2013 03:22:10 PM EST
Install Date: Wed 04 Dec 2013 10:25:42 PM EST      Build Host: c6b10.bsys.dev.centos.org
Group       : System Environment/Libraries   Source RPM: openssl-1.0.1e-16.el6_5.src.rpm
Size        : 4201414                          License: OpenSSL
Signature   : RSA/SHA1, Tue 03 Dec 2013 05:53:57 PM EST, Key ID 0946fca2c105b9de
Packager    : CentOS BuildSystem <http://bugs.centos.org>
URL         : http://www.openssl.org/
Summary     : A general purpose cryptography library with TLS implementation
Description :
The OpenSSL toolkit provides support for secure communications between
machines. OpenSSL includes a certificate management tool and shared
libraries which provide various cryptographic algorithms and
protocols.
[centoslive@livecd ~]$ openssl s_client -connect 10.111.1.105:8443
CONNECTED(00000003)
depth=0 C = US, O = Cloud, OU = Eucalyptus, CN = db
verify error:num=18:self signed certificate
verify return:1
depth=0 C = US, O = Cloud, OU = Eucalyptus, CN = db
verify return:1
---
Certificate chain

   i:/C=US/O=Cloud/OU=Eucalyptus/CN=db
---
Server certificate
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----

-----END CERTIFICATE-----

---

SSL handshake has read 1392 bytes and written 477 bytes

Server public key is 2048 bit
Secure Renegotiation IS supported
Compression: NONE

SSL-Session:
    Protocol  : TLSv1.2
    Cipher    : ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384
    Session-ID: 529FACA042DF0DE765659C56D1AE1A167801B3CBF9741CB6FEB4BCC0C7E055D8
    Session-ID-ctx:
    Master-Key: 580BE400D4D6D2E27D118B7ABBC80F2ED97B3D53630F002D849DEC8D0B80FCD71FEE26213C5029F1B9C05A316A10CF84

    PSK identity hint: None
    Start Time: 1386214126
    Timeout   : 300 (sec)
    Verify return code: 18 (self signed certificate)
---
{code}

Related Red Hat bug fix advisory:

  http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2013-1751.html

It would be good if this JIRA issue was public so the solution could be found.
Testing now on both CentOS and RHEL. Thanks [~sjones].
